meanings.definition: relating to the sense of smell
meanings.sent1: The olfactory experience of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen with a delightful aroma.
meanings.sent2: The olfactory nerves help us detect different scents in the air.
meanings.sent3: The olfactory senses were so sharp that they could smell a flower from miles away.
meanings.sent4: Her olfactory memory was so strong that the mere whiff of a certain perfume brought back vivid memories.
meanings.sent5: The olfactory sensation of the fragrant roses was so intense that it felt like a burst of happiness in her nose.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the sense of smell
meanings.sent1: The olfactory receptors in the nose help us distinguish between different odors.
meanings.sent2: Animals often rely on their olfactory abilities to find food and detect danger.
meanings.sent3: The olfactory sensitivity of the bloodhound made it the perfect detective dog.
meanings.sent4: The olfactory allure of the bakery drew customers in from blocks away.
meanings.sent5: The olfactory delight of the freshly brewed coffee made waking up early worth it.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the sense of smell
meanings.sent1: The olfactory perception of the skunk's spray was unmistakable and pungent.
meanings.sent2: The olfactory system is responsible for our ability to enjoy the aroma of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The olfactory investigation led the detective straight to the hidden stash of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The olfactory symphony of the forest in springtime was a delight to the senses.
meanings.sent5: The olfactory magic of the bakery wafted through the neighborhood, tempting everyone to follow their noses.
